items.title: Awesome Game Engine Dev
items.content_text:
### Game Engines / Awesome Collections

*   ğŸ“š [Wikipedia: List of Game Engines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_game_engines) - Game engines along with their platforms and licenses.

### Game Engines / AAA

*   ğŸ’° [C4 Engine](http://c4engine.com) - Modern console engine.
*   ğŸ’° [Gamebryo](http://www.gamebryo.com) - Complete toolset, flexible workflow, rapid prototyping.
*   ğŸ’¸ [Unigine](https://unigine.com) - Real-time 3D engine. Photorealistic graphics, large virtual worlds, C++ and C# API.

### Game Engines / Commercial

*   ğŸ’¸ [Buildbox](https://www.buildbox.com) - Create 3D & 2D video games without coding.
*   ğŸ’¸ [GameSalad](https://gamesalad.com) - Sophisticated visual programming interface.
*   ğŸ’¸ [MANU](https://manu.co) - Unique animation system helps you create games without coding.
*   ğŸ’¸ [Roblox](https://www.roblox.com/create) - Create immersive 3D experiences with Lua scripting.
*   ğŸ’¸ [Simulation Starter Kit](https://benmorris.itch.io/plugin-based-scene-editor) - Create interactive 3D apps across a range of platforms.

### Game Engines / Specialty

*   ğŸ”’ [HARFANG 3D (â­620)](https://github.com/harfang3d/harfang3d) - 3D visualization library for industry professionals, usable in C++, Python, Lua, Go.
*   ğŸ’° [RPG Maker](https://www.rpgmakerweb.com) - Create an original role-playing game without any specialized knowledge.

### Learning / Computer Graphics

*   Blog Articles
    *   ğŸ“š [Comparison of Modern Graphics APIs](https://alain.xyz/blog/comparison-of-modern-graphics-apis) - Modern graphics APIs vs older APIs.
    *   ğŸ“š [GPU Performance for Game Artists](http://www.fragmentbuffer.com/gpu-performance-for-game-artists/) - Common art-related performance issues.
*   Graphics API: DirectX
    *   ğŸŒ [DirectX](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/directx) - *Microsoft* API used to create 2D/3D games and apps. \[[Blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/directx/) | [Samples (â­6.5k)](https://github.com/microsoft/DirectX-Graphics-Samples)]
    *   ğŸ“š [DirectXTutorial.com](http://www.directxtutorial.com/default.aspx) - Older resource with lots of tutorials on DirectX versions 9 & 11.
*   Graphics API: OpenGL
    *   ğŸ“š [LearnOpenGL](https://learnopengl.com) ğŸ”¥ - Incredible! In depth tutorials for modern graphics programming.
    *   ğŸŒ [Mesa 3D](https://www.mesa3d.org/) - Open source implementations of OpenGL.
    *   ğŸŒ [OpenGL](https://www.opengl.org/) - The industry's foundation for high-performance graphics.
    *   ğŸ“š [OpenGL Tutorial](https://www.opengl-tutorial.org) - Collection of OpenGL tutorials with source code examples.
*   Graphics API: Vulkan
    *   ğŸŒ [Vulkan](https://www.vulkan.org) - Modern cross-platform graphics API. \[[Samples (â­4.8k)](https://github.com/khronosGroup/Vulkan-samples)]
    *   ğŸ“š [Vulkan Tutorial](https://vulkan-tutorial.com) - Teaches the basics of using Vulkan graphics and compute API.
*   Graphics API: WebGL
    *   ğŸŒ [WebGL](https://www.khronos.org/webgl/) - Open web standard 3D graphics API. \[[GitHub (â­2.7k)](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/WebGL)]
    *   ğŸ“š [WebGL Fundamentals](https://webglfundamentals.org) ğŸ”¥ - Full understanding of what WebGL really is and how it works.
    *   ğŸ“š [WebGL 2 Fundamentals](https://webgl2fundamentals.org) - Updated to use the WebGL2 standard.
    *   ğŸ“š [WebGL 2 Samples (â­1k)](https://github.com/WebGLSamples/WebGL2Samples) - Short and easy to understand samples demonstrating WebGL 2 features.
    *   ğŸ“š [WebGL Tutorial](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API/Tutorial) - How to use the canvas element to draw WebGL graphics.

### Learning / Engine Development

*   Blog Articles
    *   ğŸ“š [How to Become a Game Engine Developer](https://www.haroldserrano.com/blog/how-to-become-a-game-engine-developer) - Starting point on game engine development.
*   Books
    *   ğŸ“š [Game Engine Architecture](https://www.gameenginebook.com) - Theory and practice of game engine development.

### Learning / Game Development

*   Awesome Collections
    *   ğŸ“š [Awesome Gamedev (â­2.7k)](https://github.com/Calinou/awesome-gamedev#readme) - Collection of free resources for making games.
    *   ğŸ“š [GameDev-Resources (â­4.3k)](https://github.com/Kavex/GameDev-Resources) - Wonderful list of game development resources.
    *   ğŸ“š [Magictools (â­15k)](https://github.com/ellisonleao/magictools#readme) - List of game development resources to make magic happen.
    *   ğŸŒ [Web Game Dev](https://www.webgamedev.com) - Resources on techniques and tools around JavaScript game development.
*   Books
    *   ğŸ“š [Art of Game Design](https://www.amazon.com/Art-Game-Design-Book-Lenses/dp/0123694965) - Teaches game design in an accessible manner.
    *   ğŸ“š [Game Programming Patterns](https://gameprogrammingpatterns.com) - Patterns found in games that make code easier to understand.
*   Developer Portals
    *   ğŸŒ [Game Developer](https://www.gamedeveloper.com) - Industry blogs, events, jobs, updates and more. Formerly *Gamasutra*.
    *   ğŸŒ [GameDev.net](https://www.gamedev.net/) - Game dev forums, tutorials, blogs, projects, portfolios, and news.
    *   ğŸŒ [GameFromScratch.com](https://gamefromscratch.com) - Game dev news, tutorials and much more.
    *   ğŸŒ [itch.io](https://itch.io) - Game dev resources and platform to showcase / promote / buy & sell games.
*   Education Portals
    *   ğŸŒ [Lazy Foo' Tutorials](https://lazyfoo.net/tutorials/SDL/) - Beginning game programming with SDL.

### Learning / Programming

*   ğŸ“š [Big-O Cheat Sheet](https://www.bigocheatsheet.com) - Big-O complexities of algorithms used in computer science.
*   ğŸŒ [Deadlock Empire](https://deadlockempire.github.io/#menu) - Interactive tutorial to master threads and concurrency.
*   ğŸ“š [Every Programmer Should Know (â­87k)](https://github.com/mtdvio/every-programmer-should-know) - Technical things every developer should know.
*   ğŸ“š [Games of Coding (â­2k)](https://github.com/michelpereira/awesome-games-of-coding#readme) - Games that teach you a programming language.
*   ğŸŒ [Geeks for Geeks](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org) - Tutorials, articles, courses, coding competitions, jobs and more.
*   ğŸ“š [Learn to Program (â­4.4k)](https://github.com/karlhorky/learn-to-program#readme) - Educational resources to learn to program.

### Libraries / C

*   C: Cross-Platform
    *   ğŸ‰ [Cosmopolitan (â­20k)](https://github.com/jart/cosmopolitan) - Build-once run-anywhere C library.
*   C: Entity Component System
    *   ğŸ‰ [Flecs (â­7.3k)](https://github.com/SanderMertens/flecs) - Fast and lightweight entity component system in C99.
*   C: File Formats
    *   ğŸ‰ [Assimp (â­12k)](https://github.com/assimp/assimp) - Open Asset Importer Library. Loads 40+ 3D file formats.
    *   ğŸ‰ [cgltf (â­1.6k)](https://github.com/jkuhlmann/cgltf) - Single-file glTF 2.0 loader and writer in C99.
    *   â­ [dr\_libs (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/mackron/dr_libs) - Single-file audio decoding libraries.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Libspng (â­789)](https://github.com/randy408/libspng) - Simple, modern libpng alternative.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Miniz (â­2.4k)](https://github.com/richgel999/miniz) - Single-file drop-in replacement for zlib's most used APIs (*libpng* and *libzip*).
    *   ğŸ‰ [OBJ GL Loader v2 (â­12)](https://github.com/karolek471/objgl) - Quite fast wavefront OBJ loader for OpenGL.
    *   ğŸ‰ [PL\_MPEG (â­857)](https://github.com/phoboslab/pl_mpeg) - Single-file library for decoding MPEG1 Video and MP2 Audio.
    *   ğŸ‰ [QOI (â­7.2k)](https://github.com/phoboslab/qoi) - The â€œQuite OK Image Formatâ€ for fast, lossless image compression.
    *   â­ [stb\_vorbis (â­29k)](https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/stb_vorbis.c) - Ogg Vorbis audio decoder.
*   C: File System
    *   ğŸ‰ [HexEmbed (â­50)](https://github.com/codeplea/hexembed) - Small utility to help embed files in C/C++ programs in an easy, cross-platform way.
    *   â­ [Incbin (â­1.1k)](https://github.com/graphitemaster/incbin) - Include binary and text files in your C/C++ apps with ease.
    *   ğŸ‰ [PhysicsFS (â­643)](https://github.com/icculus/physfs) - Portable, flexible file I/O abstraction. Provides access to various archives.
    *   â­ [Where Am I (â­495)](https://github.com/gpakosz/whereami) - Locates the current path on the local file system.
*   C: Fonts
    *   ğŸ‰ [Font Stash (â­722)](https://github.com/memononen/fontstash) - Lightweight library that uses stb\_truetype to render fonts to a texture atlas.
    *   ğŸ‰ [IconFontCppHeaders (â­1.3k)](https://github.com/juliettef/IconFontCppHeaders) - C/C++ headers and C# classes for icon fonts.
    *   â­ [stb\_truetype (â­29k)](https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/stb_truetype.h) - Single-header file library that processes TrueType font files.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Vertext (â­30)](https://github.com/kevinmkchin/vertext) - Generates vertices for rendering text, requires stb\_truetype.
*   C: Lighting
    *   â­ [Light Mapper (â­1.5k)](https://github.com/ands/lightmapper) - Single-file library for lightmap baking by using your existing OpenGL renderer.
*   C: Network
    *   ğŸ‰ [librg (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/zpl-c/librg) - Middleware between networking / file-streaming libraries and app logic.

### Libraries / C++

*   C++: Entity Component System
    *   ğŸ‰ [EntityX (â­2.3k)](https://github.com/alecthomas/entityx) - Fast, type-safe C++ entity component system.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Entt (â­11k)](https://github.com/skypjack/entt) - Gaming meets modern C++, a fast and reliable entity component system.
*   C++: Geometry
    *   ğŸ‰ [CinoLib (â­1k)](https://github.com/mlivesu/cinolib) - Header-only library for processing polygonal and polyhedral meshes.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Delabella (â­236)](https://github.com/msokalski/delabella) - Super stable 2D delaunay triangulation.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Delaunator-Cpp (â­0)](https://github.com/soerendd/delaunator-cpp) - Really fast library for Delaunay triangulation of 2D points.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Easy3D (â­1.5k)](https://github.com/LiangliangNan/Easy3D) - Easy-to-use library for 3D modeling, geometry processing, and rendering.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Extrude (â­22)](https://github.com/stevinz/extrude) - Converts 2D images into 3D extruded meshes.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Generator (â­226)](https://github.com/ilmola/generator) - Procedural geometry generation library for C++11.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Geometric Tools](https://www.geometrictools.com/index.html) - Mathematics, geometry, graphics, image analysis and physics in C++14.
    *   ğŸ‰ [GeometronLib (â­97)](https://github.com/LukasBanana/GeometronLib) - Meshes for 3D shapes (cube, sphere, etc.) and ray / geometry intersection.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Libigl (â­4.8k)](https://github.com/libigl/libigl) - Simple geometry processing library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [MeshOptimizer (â­6.4k)](https://github.com/zeux/meshoptimizer) - Mesh optimization library that makes meshes smaller and faster to render.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Polygon Mesh Processing Library (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/pmp-library/pmp-library) - Processing / visualizing polygon surface meshes.
    *   ğŸ‰ [PolyPartition (â­682)](https://github.com/ivanfratric/polypartition) - 2D polygon partitioning and triangulation.
    *   â­ [RamerDouglasPeucker](https://gist.github.com/TimSC/0813573d77734bcb6f2cd2cf6cc7aa51) - Reduces number of points along a 2D line.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Recast & Detour (â­7.1k)](https://github.com/recastnavigation/recastnavigation) - Navigation-mesh toolset for games.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Seam-aware Decimater (â­514)](https://github.com/songrun/SeamAwareDecimater) - Simplifies mesh while preserving UVs, based on [Seamless](https://cragl.cs.gmu.edu/seamless/).
    *   ğŸ‰ [Spheres (â­268)](https://github.com/caosdoar/spheres) - Four methods to create a sphere mesh.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Trimesh2](https://gfx.cs.princeton.edu/proj/trimesh2/) - Utilities for input, output, and manipulation of 3D triangle meshes.
    *   ğŸ‰ [V-HACD (â­1.5k)](https://github.com/kmammou/v-hacd) - Decomposes a 3D surface into a set of "near" convex parts.
*   C++: Lighting
    *   ğŸ‰ [Thekla Atlas (â­475)](https://github.com/Thekla/thekla_atlas) - Atlas generation tool.
    *   ğŸ‰ [UVAtlas (â­880)](https://github.com/Microsoft/UVAtlas) - DirectX library for creating and packing texture atlases.
*   C++: Utility
    *   ğŸ‰ [Any-Lite (â­143)](https://github.com/martinmoene/any-lite) - Header-only 'any' type for C++98 and above.
    *   ğŸ‰ [EASTL (â­8.8k)](https://github.com/electronicarts/EASTL/) - Electronic Arts STL replacement, emphasis on performance.
    *   ğŸ‰ [faker-cxx (â­365)](https://github.com/cieslarmichal/faker-cxx) - C++20 Faker library for generating fake (but realistic) data for testing and development.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Parallel Hashmap (â­3k)](https://github.com/greg7mdp/parallel-hashmap) - Header-only, fast and memory-friendly hashmap and binary tree containers.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Spdlog (â­27k)](https://github.com/gabime/spdlog) - Fast logging library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Tiny-Process-Library](https://gitlab.com/eidheim/tiny-process-library) - Making it simple to create and stop new processes.
    *   ğŸ‰ [TinyXML-2 (â­5.4k)](https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2) - XML parser that can be easily integrated into other programs.
*   C++: Visual Programming / Nodes
    *   ğŸ‰ [NodeEditor (â­3.4k)](https://github.com/paceholder/nodeeditor) - Graph-controlled data processing, built with *Qt*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [QuickQanava (â­1.3k)](https://github.com/cneben/QuickQanava) - Display graphs and relational content in a *QtQuick*-based app, in C++14.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Visual Script Engine (â­203)](https://github.com/kovacsv/VisualScriptEngine) - Visual scripting engine designed for embedding.

### Libraries / C#

*   C#: App Framework
    *   ğŸ‰ [ATF (â­1.9k)](https://github.com/SonyWWS/ATF) - Components for making tools on Windows, started in 2005.
*   C#: Audio
    *   ğŸ‰ [NAudio (â­5.9k)](https://github.com/naudio/NAudio) - Audio and MIDI library for .NET.
*   C#: Game Engine w/Editor
    *   ğŸ‰ [Duality (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality) - Modular 2D engine, editor built with *OpenTK*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Flat Red Ball (â­486)](https://github.com/vchelaru/FlatRedBall) - 2D game engine & design tools, built with *MonoGame*. \[[Website](https://flatredball.com/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Murder (â­2.9k)](https://github.com/isadorasophia/murder) - Pixel-art, ECS game engine built on *MonoGame*. \[[Docs](https://isadorasophia.com/murder/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Stride (â­7k)](https://github.com/stride3d/stride) - Game engine for realistic rendering and VR. Formerly *Xenko*. \[[Website](https://www.stride3d.net/)]
    *   ğŸ’¸ [Unity](https://store.unity.com/) - Biggest name in game engines, industry standard.

### Libraries / Haxe

*   Haxe: App Framework
    *   ğŸ‰ [Lime (â­799)](https://github.com/haxelime/lime) - Flexible, lightweight layer for Haxe cross-platform developers.
    *   ğŸ‰ [nme (â­489)](https://github.com/haxenme/nme) - Cross-platform native backend for Haxe projects.
*   Haxe: Serialization / Storage
    *   ğŸ‰ [CastleDB (â­581)](https://github.com/ncannasse/castle) - Structured database with a local web service to edit it.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Format (â­135)](https://github.com/HaxeFoundation/format) - Various files formats support for Haxe.
    *   ğŸ‰ [HxBit (â­160)](https://github.com/HeapsIO/hxbit) - Binary serialization and network synchronization library.
*   Haxe: Utility
    *   ğŸ‰ [hexMachina (â­6)](https://github.com/DoclerLabs/hexCore) - Powerful modular MVC framework. \[[Website](http://hexmachina.org/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [HxColorToolkit (â­45)](https://github.com/andyli/hxColorToolkit) - Library for color conversion and color scheme generation.
    *   ğŸ‰ [HxMath (â­91)](https://github.com/tbrosman/hxmath) - Game-oriented math library for the Haxe language.
    *   ğŸ‰ [SteamWrap (â­114)](https://github.com/larsiusprime/SteamWrap) - Haxe native extension for the Steam API.
*   Haxe: Visual Programming / Nodes
    *   ğŸ‰ [Haxe-Blockly (â­5)](https://github.com/nickmain/haxe-blockly) - Haxe wrapper for [Blockly](https://developers.google.com/blockly)

### Libraries / JavaScript

*   JavaScript: Entity Component System
    *   ğŸ‰ [Becsy (â­251)](https://github.com/LastOliveGames/becsy) - Multithreaded ECS for TypeScript and JavaScript.
    *   ğŸ”’ [bitECS (â­1.1k)](https://github.com/NateTheGreatt/bitECS) - Functional, minimal, data-oriented, ultra-high performance ECS library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Ecsy (â­1.1k)](https://github.com/ecsyjs/ecsy) - Experimental ECS aiming to be lightweight, easy to use.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Miniplex (â­924)](https://github.com/hmans/miniplex) - Entity management system for games.
*   JavaScript: File Formats
    *   ğŸ‰ [JSMpeg (â­6.5k)](https://github.com/phoboslab/jsmpeg) - MPEG1 Video Decoder in JavaScript.
*   JavaScript: Graphics - 3D
    *   ğŸ‰ [Babylon.js (â­24k)](https://github.com/BabylonJS/Babylon.js) ğŸ”¥ - Powerful web rendering engine. \[[Extensions (â­181)](https://github.com/BabylonJS/Extensions) | [Website](https://www.babylonjs.com/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [ClayGL (â­2.8k)](https://github.com/pissang/claygl) - WebGL library for scalable Web3D applications.
    *   ğŸ‰ [CopperLicht](https://ambiera.com/copperlicht/) - A 3D library for WebGL. \[[CopperCube Editor](https://ambiera.com/coppercube/index.html)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Filament for Web (â­19k)](https://github.com/google/filament/tree/main/web/filament-js) - WebAssembly build of Google's 3D graphics library, Filament. \[[Demos](https://google.github.io/filament/webgl/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Four (â­336)](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/four) - Minimal three.js alternative.
